subject: Marketing
title: The PAS Framework
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The PAS Framework.

hook.text: Problem. Agitate. Solve. Three words that structure the most successful sales copy in history.

buildup.text: PAS names the reader's problem, makes them feel the pain, then presents the solution.

discovery.text: Agitation is the key step‚Äîit makes the problem vivid and urgent before offering relief.

twist.text: Without agitation, the solution feels unnecessary. People don't fix problems they don't feel.

climax.text: PAS works because it mirrors how humans naturally process problems and seek solutions.

punchline.text: Name the pain. Twist the knife. Then heal the wound.

quiz.question: What does PAS stand for in copywriting?
